title: Label issues is ambiguous
body:
### Component

Other (please describe)

### Describe the feature you would like

Labeling issues as Ignore is ambiguous: ignore for what reason?

Example: there are both PRs that have been merged and closed with this label. That really confuses me as to the semantics of this label. Either its meaningful or its not. Basically i am just ignoring the ignore label. 

also it may dissuade future contributors with the impression that there work is not valued for what ever reasons.

 

### Additional context

_No response_

It excludes it from the automated changelog and is for things that are not user facing such as refactoring, internal changes or features that are not enabled yet. This should also be evident from the label description, but I've updated it slightly to disambiguate it. If you have better ideas for names feel free to suggest, but I don't think this should be an issue we track, probably just a discussion on Telegram if anything

Thanks for the earnest response.

Parity has a few labels that may be worthwhile 

e.g.
P7-nicetohave 
Z1-mentor 


You can manage issues now via the GitHub CLI, here is how I grabbed their list of issue labels 

```bash
gh label list --sort name -R paritytech/substrate -L 100 --json name,description,color
```

Pretty much all of these already exist in some variant with a slightly different name, so unsure how that solves your original issue with the ignore label?

Closing this since I think we're OK here, feel free to ping me on Telegram if you have suggestions for a better label name. In the future we will probably have an "opt-in" changelog label instead of an "opt-out" because we're going to write the changelog manually for new releases
